page.title: 12Gordleton Farm-Blacksmith
page.content: The blacksmith's forge is an out building of the orignal Gordleton Farm in Silver Street. There is a{farrier,} a{general smith}and an apprentice. Traditionally apprenticeships lasted 8 years and cost the apprentice a penny per week. The{farrier}makes horse shoes and travels the area to shoe about 6horses a day. The{general smith}specialises in wrought iron work,making ornamental pieces for sale in his New Milton shop, and restoration work. The{forge}burns coke instead of coal and an electric fan has replaced the bellows. Electric welders are used for intricate wrought iron work but they prefer to maintain traditional methods where possible. Both smiths take part in the New Forest Show and are keen to revive the festival of St Clem's-November 23rd.
